title: A5. Pebbling odometer - subtask 5
code:
odometer
# Initialize the direction to move through the grid
right

# Labels for looping through the grid
row_start:
# Check if the current cell has fewer pebbles than the current minimum
pebble update_min
move
jump row_start
update_min:
# Update logic for new minimum
halt

title: A5. Pebbling odometer - subtask 5
code:
odometer
# Initialize and face east to traverse the grid row by row
right

# Starting point for grid traversal
start:

# Store the current cell's pebble count as the potential minimum
put # Temporarily add a pebble to mark this cell
left
move
pebble skip_compare
right
put # Restore original pebble count
move

title: A3. Pebbling odometer - subtask 3
code:
odometer
# Move to the first pebble in row 0
right
find_first:
pebble first_found
move
jump find_first

first_found:
put # Mark the first pebble's position
move

# Move to find the second pebble in row 0
find_second:
pebble second_found
move
jump find_second

second_found:
# Calculate the midpoint
right
right
move_to_first:
pebble back_to_midpoint
move
jump move_to_first

back_to_midpoint:
right
right
move
move_to_midpoint:
pebble midpoint_reached
move
move
jump move_to_midpoint

midpoint_reached:
halt

title: A3. Pebbling odometer - subtask 3
code:
plaintext
# Move right to start traversing row 0
right

# Loop to find the first pebble
find_first_pebble:
pebble first_found
move
jump find_first_pebble

# Save the position of the first pebble
first_found:
put
right
right

# Loop to find the second pebble
find_second_pebble:
pebble second_found
move
jump find_second_pebble

# Save the position of the second pebble
second_found:
put
right
right

# Start moving back to compute the midpoint
compute_midpoint:
get
move
pebble midpoint_found
jump compute_midpoint

# Stop at the midpoint
midpoint_found:
halt

title: A3. Pebbling odometer - subtask 3
code:
plaintext
# Start by facing east to traverse row 0
right

# Loop to find the first pebble
find_first_pebble:
pebble first_pebble_found
move
jump find_first_pebble

# First pebble found; mark its position
first_pebble_found:
put
left # Turn around to traverse back
return_to_start:
border start_traversal
move
jump return_to_start

start_traversal:
right # Face east again

# Loop to find the second pebble
find_second_pebble:
pebble second_pebble_found
move
jump find_second_pebble

# Second pebble found; mark its position
second_pebble_found:
put

# Calculate midpoint by moving back and forth
calculate_midpoint:
left # Turn around to traverse back
return_to_start_again:
border midpoint_calculation
get
move
jump return_to_start_again

midpoint_calculation:
right # Face east again
move # Move to midpoint
get # Remove pebble at midpoint
halt

title: A3. Pebbling odometer - subtask 3
code:
odometer
# Move to the first pebble in row 0
right
find_first_pebble:
pebble found_first # pebble found
border found_first # end of the row
move
jump find_first_pebble

found_first:
# Store the position of the first pebble
left
put
right

# Move to the second pebble
find_second_pebble:
move
pebble found_second # pebble found
border found_second # end of the row
jump find_second_pebble

found_second:
# Store the position of the second pebble
left
put
put
right

# Return to the beginning of the row
reset_position:
border start_midpoint
left
left
move
right
right
jump reset_position

start_midpoint:
# Compute the midpoint
midpoint_loop:
get
border midpoint_found
move
jump midpoint_loop

midpoint_found:
# Odometer is now at the midpoint, terminate
halt

A1. Pebbling odometer - subtask 1
code:
odometer
# Move to cell (0, 1)
right
move

# Compare pebbles in (0, 0) and (0, 1)
check:
pebble less # If (0, 1) has pebbles, go to less
left
move
halt

less:
halt

title: A1. Pebbling odometer - subtask 1

move
jump halt_program

right

title: A1. Pebbling odometer - subtask 1
code:
plaintext
# Subtask 1: Terminate at (0, 0) if pebbles in (0, 0) <= pebbles in (0, 1), otherwise terminate at (0, 1)

check:
pebble move_right
halt

move_right:
right
move
halt

title: A1. Pebbling odometer - subtask 1
code:
odometer
# Solution for Subtask 1
# This program compares the number of pebbles in (0, 0) and (0, 1) and
# moves the odometer to the appropriate cell.

start:
pebble check  # If (0, 0) has at least one pebble, jump to the "check" label
right         # Turn right to face east (towards (0, 1))
move          # Move to cell (0, 1)
halt          # End program if x  y

check:
get           # Remove one pebble from (0, 0)
left          # Turn left to face west (back towards (0, 0))
move          # Move back to (0, 0)
pebble start  # If (0, 0) still has pebbles, jump back to "start"
right         # Turn right to face east (towards (0, 1))
move          # Move to cell (0, 1)
halt          # End program if x > y

title: A1. Pebbling odometer - subtask 1
code:
plaintext
# Turn to face east (towards (0, 1))
right

# Check if there is at least one pebble in (0, 0)
check_pebble:
pebble move_to_01 # If there is a pebble in (0, 0), jump to move_to_01
move                # Move to (0, 1)
left                # Turn back to face (0, 0)
jump check_pebble    # Repeat the check loop

move_to_01:
halt                 # Halt the program
